TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, ShuttlePilot said:
> 
> 
> Why are there accounts that once were moderators but now they are just simple users, what happened? Did they violate the rules? Or is that due to inactivity?
> 

It's a significant commitment, and it's an unpaid 'volunteer' job.  It's not a life-sentence though.  As an example, at this point in time I am able to devote a few hours per day to moderation duties.  If work or family commitments change and I need to back out of my moderation duties, I am able to do that. My take is, again, it's not a life sentence to be assigned as a moderator.  We all have lives, both personal and professional outside of our moderator duties.  When life happens, sometimes time commitments have to be adjusted.

Depends on how much needs to be done. For me it's anywhere from half an hour to 3 hours.

> 23 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:

> How long a day do you spend moderating?

I'm normally only on about 4-5 days per week.  On those days I'm usually available for 3-5 hours.  However, the time spent actually doing moderation is much less.  Most days there's maybe an hour spent actually moderating anything- y'all are remarkably polite for the most part.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  But personally, I try to be available at least 3 hours per day, at least 4 days per week.

I think it's a matter of people putting time into something they care about. Every moderator I ever worked with cares a great deal about this community. In a similar way, some great individuals put their time and energy into making mods, writing stories, creating beautiful artwork to share with others etc. 

These are all different ways of giving something back to the community. Doing things for others is actually a great way to get joy out of life.
